schedule.what_to_do: Wake up, stretch, and drink a glass of water. Check social media for overnight messages/notifications.
Prepare and eat breakfast - usually toast with avocado and a small salad. Listen to a Japanese podcast while eating.
schedule.interaction_target: Toaster, Kitchen Knife, Podcast App (on Smartphone)

schedule.what_to_do: Edit photos from yesterday's shoot at Osu Kannon Temple. Focus on color correction and cropping.
Research potential locations for a new Nagoya food photography project - specifically looking for interesting ramen shops in the Sakae area. Check Instagram and Tabelog for recommendations.
schedule.interaction_target: Laptop, Instagram App (on Smartphone), Tabelog Website

schedule.what_to_do: Head to Sakae. Explore the area around Oasis 21 and Nagoya TV Tower, scouting for good angles and lighting for potential photoshoots. Grab a coffee at a local cafe.
schedule.interaction_target: Camera, Smartphone (for navigation), Coffee Shop, Oasis 21, Nagoya TV Tower

schedule.what_to_do: Lunch at a local *miso katsu* restaurant near Sakae. Photograph the dish for my food blog.
Visit Atsuta Shrine. Take photos of the shrine architecture and surrounding gardens. Focus on capturing the peaceful atmosphere.
Return to my apartment. Back up photos from the day onto my external hard drive and cloud storage.
schedule.interaction_target: Laptop, External Hard Drive, Cloud Storage (Google Drive)

schedule.what_to_do: Edit photos from Atsuta Shrine. Select the best images and begin post-processing.

schedule.interaction_target: Kitchen Stove, Kitchen Knife, Rice Cooker

schedule.what_to_do: Eat dinner while watching a Japanese drama on Netflix.
Respond to emails and messages. Update my Instagram feed with photos from the day.
Plan tomorrow's schedule. Research a potential day trip to Inuyama Castle.
Skincare routine and prepare for bed.
Read a book in bed before sleeping.
